p.subject: University of Chicago - Student Life and Athletics

titlepage.titleproper: Guide to the Dorothy Crowder Chessman Paperscirca 1987
titlepage.author: Finding aid prepared by EMS, 1992; RG, 2002; KEF, 2009

did.head: Descriptive Summary

address.addressline: Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center

did.abstract: Dorothy Crowder Chessman, teacher. The Dorothy Crowder Chessman Papers consist of a manuscript from 1987 titled “University of Chicago Days.” In it Chessman describes her experiences as a student at the University of Chicago.

accessrestrict.head: Access
accessrestrict.p: The collection is open for research.

prefercite.head: Citation
prefercite.p: When quoting material from this collection, the preferred citation is: Chessman, Dorothy Crowder. Papers, [Box #, Folder #], Hanna Holborn Gray Special Collections Research Center, University of Chicago Library

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Dorothy Crowder Chessman attended Bradley Polytechnic Institute (now Bradley University) from 1915 to 1917. In 1917 Chessman enrolled at the University of Chicago, graduating in 1919 with a Ph.B in English. While at the University of Chicago, Chessman was a member of Pi Beta Phi.
Chessman taught English at Peoria High School after college.

scopecontent.head: Scope Note
scopecontent.p: The Dorothy Crowder Chessman Papers consist of a manuscript from 1987 titled “University of Chicago Days.” In it Chessman describes her experiences as a student at the University of Chicago.
